intro: Chamaesium wolffianum, commonly known as the Wolffian chamaesium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite inflorescence. Chamaesium wolffianum is often found in high-altitude habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
